intro: Grumilea dolichantha, commonly known as the long-stalked grumia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, elliptical leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale yellow, with five petals and a prominent tube. Grumilea dolichantha is often found in tropical rainforests, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments.
